ab.ab: "(Pers.) puršeš ānke sī-o se hunar pīrāman-e hāvan čīst pāsoḫ īnke ϑriiasca. ϑrisą̇sca. nazdišta. sī-o se hunar ān ast ke bīst-o yek nask-e avestā ke yazešn mīkonand kār-e yazešn ast va dar yazešngāh hāvan ǧāmdān ūrvarām va barahūm va barsom ke dādār urmazd parāǧ āmuḫt uy zartošt zltwwšt parāǧ goft uy mardomān ku con āvāyad kardan beyazdān kām"

"The question is which are the thirty three hunar around hāuuani? The answer is: ϑriiasca. ϑrisą̇sca. nazdišta. The thirty three hunar are are those, which are the twenty one Nask of the Avesta, that they use in the Yasna. The apparatus of the Yasna in the Yazišn-gāh are the hāwan, the ǧāmdān, the ūrvarām, the parahōm and the barsom [...], that the creator Ohrmazd taught to Zardušt (and Zardušt) taught to the men, how this should be done according to the wishes of the yazdān."

"ϑriiasca. ϑrəsą̇saca. nazdišta. piriš. hāuuaniiō. ẏō. həṇti. aṣ̌ahe. ẏat̰. vaheštahe. mazdō. frasāsta. zaraϑuštrō. fraoxta The meaning in the Avesta is that the thirty three hunar that are around hāuuani that the dastūrs use, Ormazd taught to Zartošt and he tought to the humanity, how should be done and why should be done.

porseš ānke sī-o se pīše-ye hīrbadān čīst pāsoḫ ānke har vīspēbiiō. aēbiiō. ratubiiō. har vesp rad ke and ašā sī-o se pīrāmon-e hāvan ke ūrmazd farāǧ āmuḫt ūy zartošt zarātošt farāǧ goft ūy mardomān ke čenīn āvāyad kardan īn sī-o se pīše-ye hīrvadān ke andar yazešn kār-e yazešn konand

"The question is: which are the thirty three crafts of the hērbad? The answer is this: each vīspēbiiō. aēbiiō. ratubiiō.. All these rad are holy, the thirty three around hāuuani that Ormazd taught Zardušt and Zardušt told to the humanity how they should be used. These thirty three crafts that the hērbad use in a Yasna during the performing of the Yasna."
